title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, November 18, 1865
summary: Two days after establishing an AMA school in Staunton, Scott writes to report on his initial activities in the Valley. He states that he has been looking for rooms in which to hold school and explains that the teachers "get frequent sneers, but good treatment to the face."
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
